name: L-Theanine
summary: L-theanine is an amino acid found primarily in green tea leaves, known for its calming, anxiolytic, and focus-enhancing properties without sedation.
description: L-theanine is a naturally occurring amino acid found in tea (Camellia sinensis) and certain mushrooms. It is best known for promoting relaxation without drowsiness, supporting stress reduction, and enhancing attention and cognitive performance, especially when combined with caffeine. Mechanistically, L-theanine influences neurotransmitter activity, including GABA, serotonin, and dopamine, and may modulate alpha brain waves, contributing to its calming yet alertness-promoting effects. It is generally safe, well tolerated, and commonly used as a nootropic and anxiolytic supplement.

metadata.fda_status: Dietary supplement (not FDA-approved for medical treatment)

off_label_uses: Support for nicotine or caffeine withdrawal
contraindications: Hypersensitivity to L-theanine or tea extracts
Use with sedative medications without medical supervision
monitoring_required: Interactions with sedative or stimulant use

items: Reduce stress and promote relaxation without sedation
Support sleep onset and sleep quality
Enhance focus, especially in combination with caffeine

sections.text: L-theanine crosses the blood-brain barrier and modulates neurotransmitter activity by increasing levels of GABA, dopamine, and serotonin. It also enhances alpha brain wave activity, promoting relaxation and calm alertness. Its synergistic effects with caffeine enhance attention and reduce mental fatigue.

adult.typical: 100–400 mg daily, divided doses or as needed
adult.note: 100–200 mg often used for acute relaxation or pre-sleep support.

sections.pediatric: 50–200 mg daily has been studied in children with ADHD, under clinical supervision.

sections.text: Onset of calming effects may occur within 30–60 minutes. Duration of action is approximately 6–8 hours depending on dose.

other: Use cautiously with sedative medications due to additive effects.
May lower blood pressure; monitor in hypotensive patients.
Generally considered safe, but long-term safety in pregnancy and lactation not established.

sections.pregnancy: Safety not well studied; avoid unless supervised by a clinician
sections.pediatrics: Has been studied in ADHD with some benefit; use under medical guidance
sections.geriatrics: Generally safe; monitor for additive sedative effects

sections.text: No tapering required; discontinuation does not cause withdrawal.

items: L-theanine synergizes well with caffeine for balanced cognitive enhancement.
Popular in nootropic stacks for focus, calm, and productivity.
May reduce stress-induced increases in heart rate and blood pressure.

seo.title: L-Theanine – Natural Anxiolytic and Nootropic
seo.description: L-theanine is an amino acid from green tea that promotes relaxation, focus, and sleep quality. Learn about its benefits, dosing, safety, and interactions.
